shellshocker

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • shellshocker.Weapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Rotatable

    public class Weapon
extends java.lang.Object
implements Rotatable
    Creates objects that simulate explosive weapons. Weapons will be able to change location, speed, and direction. Projectiles that the weapons fire include lasers, bullets, shells, and missiles that will inflict damage to enemies and the user-controlled character.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Weapon()
      Default constructor that initializes lists. Also takes in images for the different weapons.
      Weapon(int type, double x, double y, double dX, double dY, double xSpd, double ySpd, double rotate, java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
      Constructor creates a weapon object with variables of weapon type, x and y coordinates for location, x and y vectors for speed, and a rotation constant.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics window)
      Draws all currently active weapons in the specified Graphics context.

      Generates common rotated images.

      Returns the correct weapon BufferedImage based on rotation.

      Returns the weapon type.

      Returns the list of currently active weapons.

      Returns the weapon's horizontal vector of speed.

      Sets the x-coordinate of the position of the weapon to the passed parameter.

      Sets the horizontal vector of the speed of the weapon to the passed parameter.
      void setYPos(double y)
      Sets the y-coordinate of the position of the weapon to the passed parameter.
      void setYSpd(double y)
      Sets the vertical vector of the speed of the weapon to the passed parameter.
      void update()
      Updates the drawing and reference locations of each weapon.

        public Weapon(int type,
      double x,
      double y,
      double dX,
      double dY,
      double xSpd,
      double ySpd,
      double rotate,
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        Constructor creates a weapon object with variables of weapon type, x and y coordinates for location, x and y vectors for speed, and a rotation constant.
        Parameters:
        type - the weapon type as designated by an integer.
        x - the weapon's x-coordinate location.
        y - the weapon's y-coordinate location.
        dX - the weapon's drawing x-coordinate location.
        dY - the weapon's drawing y-coordinate location.
        xSpd - the weapon's horizontal speed vector.
        ySpd - the weapon's vertical speed vector.
        rotate - the weapon's rotation constant.
        img -
